A library of functions that do geometric opeations. These are all static methods, so you never need to make an instance of this class. Needs-More-Work: many of these are not done yet or not used yet.

· mid

Summary  |  Top 
   public static int mid(int a, 
                         int b, 
                         int c)

Given three ints, return the one with the middle value. I.e., it is not the single largest or the single smallest.

· nearPolySegment

Summary  |  Top 
   public static synchronized boolean nearPolySegment(int[] xs, 
                                                      int[] ys, 
                                                      int n, 
                                                      int x, 
                                                      int y, 
                                                      int grip)

Reply true iff the given point is within grip pixels of one of the segments of the given polygon. Needs-more-work: this is never used, I don't know that it is needed now that I use hit rectangles instead.

                                                  int y2, 
                                                  int x, 
                                                  int y, 
                                                  int grip)

Reply true iff the given point is within grip pixels of the given segment. Needs-more-work: this is never used, I don't know that it is needed now that I use hit rectangles instead.



· intersects

   public static synchronized boolean intersects(Rectangle r, 
                                                 int x1,

                                                 int x2, 
                                                 int y2)

Reply true iff the given Rectangle intersects the given line segment.



· counterClockWise

Summary  |  Top 
   public static int counterClockWise(int x1, 
                                      int y1, 
                                      int x2, 
                                      int y2, 
                                      int x, 
                                      int y)

Reply true if the given point is counter-clockwise from the vector defined by the position of the given line. This is used as in determining intersection between lines and rectangles. Taken from Algorithms in C by Sedgewick, page 350.
